com.stoyanr.mastermind

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stoyanr.mastermind.Game

  • public class Game
extends Object
    A single Mastermind game. A game is initialized with a Mastermind instance (game setup), a particular Algorithm, max number of rounds, and a Player instance. To play a game, call its play() method. The two methods hasWon() and getRoundsPlayed() should be invoked only after the game has finished to determine whether the game is won and the number of rounds it took. A game can be played only once.
    Author:
    Stoyan Rachev

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(Mastermind mastermind,
    Algorithm algorithm,
    int maxRounds,
    Player player)
        Creates a new game with the specified setup, algorithm, max number of rounds, and player. This constructor delegates to Game(Mastermind, Algorithm, int, Player, GuessCalculator) by passing null for the guess calculator.
        Parameters:
        mastermind - The game setup to use.
        algorithm - The algorithm to use.
        maxRounds - Max number of rounds allowed. If the game is not won within this number of rounds, it is terminated and declared "lost".
        player - The player to use.

      • Game

        public Game(Mastermind mastermind,
    Algorithm algorithm,
    int maxRounds,
    Player player,
    GuessCalculator calc)
        Creates a new game with the specified setup, algorithm, max number of rounds, player, and guess calculator.
        Parameters:
        mastermind - The game setup to use.
        algorithm - The algorithm to use.
        maxRounds - Max number of rounds allowed. If the game is not won within this number of rounds, it is terminated and declared "lost".
        player - The player to use.
        calc - A guess calculator used to optimize the performance of multiple games played with the same algorithm, can be null if a guess calculator should not be used.

    • Method Detail

      • play

        public final boolean play()
        Plays the game. Calls Player.startGame() and Player.endGame(boolean, int) at the beginning and at the end of the game respectively. At each game round, calls Algorithm.makeGuess(), Player.getScore(String), and Algorithm.putGuessScore(String, Score) in this order, until a correct guess is made. If this does not happen within the specified max number of rounds, it is terminated and declared lost.

        A game can be played only once. If this method is called for a second time on the same instance, an exception is thrown.

        Returns:
        true if the game is won, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        MastermindException - If the method is called for a second time on the same instance, if an empty guess is returned by the algorithm, or if another unexpected condition occurs.

      • hasWon

        public final boolean hasWon()
        Returns whether the game has been won or not. Should only be called after the game has been played, i.e. the play() method has finished.
        Returns:
        true if the game has been won, false otherwise.

      • getRoundsPlayed

        public final int getRoundsPlayed()
        Returns the actual number of rounds played. Should only be called after the game has been played, i.e. the play() method has finished.
        Returns:
        The actual number of rounds played.
